title: A very sneaky and disappointing move RIOT (very disappointed) :(
body:
The figure fest is advertised on OCE (even in the client itself) as $30 for two
however the site https:// **oce** .merch.riotgames.com/en/ 
has the figures available as $30 'USD' which itself is a sneaky move having the OCE store in american dollars.
(this is sneaky but forgivable because of the nature of setting up a website etc)

However! what really disappoints me, is that it is clearly shown in the 'OCE' client in the featured tab in the shop, that the figures are $30, and because RP purchasable through the client IS changed to NZD (or whatever country you are in) it is Incredibly misleading.
having 2 different currency's prices in the shop and have no distinction between the two, especially when the community is expecting it, just like everything else in the client store to already be turned into region specific prices, it is just a money grabbing scheme, plain and simple. Either that, or extreme laziness that will cost innocent players who aren't as aware of it.

i have played League of Legends since the end of 2012 and love the game and being a part of the lol community, and i support riot in most things, but this is just plain wrong, and I'm disappointed that they would take advantage of their trusting player base like this.

it isn't illegal, and in the merch store there is a US$ sign in the corner, but it is still a sneaky move to catch players unawares, and has affected my view of their 'most player friendly company' values.
(even Apple tries to change the currency to be not even region but COUNTRY specific, and they unlike RIOT aren't known for their customer consideration)

However like all good hypocrites i still bought my figures even though i knew they were in USD and i will continue to purchase RP unhindered.

replies.body:
Hey Lord Sesshomaru,

Please believe me when I say that I'm really sorry, and that we're not trying to be deceptive or rip you off at all. If there was any confusion regarding prices, it wasn't because we tried to be sneaky - it's because we messed up. 

If you check http://oce.leagueoflegends.com right now, you'll notice that the subline for the figure fest sale specifies that the prices are in US dollars. However, that subline doesn't appear in the client. So if you never went to the website, you probably wouldn't have picked up on it beforehand. That's my bad - I should have made it clear even for people clicking through from the client.

It's true that the site currently doesn't have an AUD/NZD option. Currently, there are difficulties displaying those prices since they're subject to exchange rates. We can nail those prices down once we find a way to make getting merch easier for everyone in OCE, but as it stands, we need to display them in USD.

Again, I'm sorry you had a negative experience with the figure sale. I know it might not mean much, but we're working on ways to make merch a less painful experience for everyone. In the meantime, I recommend you [check out this post](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L4eGcnT7-merchandising-store-update) from MasterMirkinen for full context on the USD pricing + some questions asked by other players.

Thanks for giving us this feedback - it's what helps us improve!

Hi Riot Manisier 

Thank you for saying this, you have fully restored my faith in RIOT :)

it wasn't a huge issue for me personally, my only concern is that people (especially students) who want some merch might allow for it in their budget  but not realising the US dollar price might spend that extra money unknowingly, and then later on when they need it it isn't there. 
but i do fully understand the difficulties of exchange rates and website coding issues. 

thank you again for saying this, it means a lot and I'm glad that RIOT still cares this much about their players ^^

It's really cool of you to flag this issue for other players even if it doesn't affect you directly!

Thanks for being patient and forgiving with us :)
